reviews.review_msg: this prof is beneath avg. His tests are hard,and not reflective of what he tells u to study, espicially the labs.Midterms had 25 multiple choice questions worth 4 marks each, all or nothing. Final exam had 5 T/F worth 8 points and had to write ur reasoning--HARD. But scales the exams a lot depending on class avg. Prof is French,wid POOR English.

Great! This is a class where I actually learned something that stuck with me and is  interesting. It's also refreshing to see an econ prof who is critical of unrealistic econ models and is not credulous enough to take them up on faith, unlike other simpleminded self deluding economists. Boland - one of the top three profs I ever had!
great class! we had interesting discussions about the great economic thinkers, and the social contexts which influenced their ideas. if you're interested in economics, this class is a must!

Great prof! keeps things interesting, class is formatted so you do your readings, then ask questions about them. All you need to do is ask questions and you will do well! Class is mostly based on class participation. Very interesting course

Probably one of the best profs I've had at SFU. Talks about current events and relates it to the reading. He doesn't encourage you to ask about ur grades but he does encourage you to ask questions! I enjoyed it very much. He seems like a mean guy but it's all an act he's in fact a very nice guy!
Best class I've ever attended. Boland is very knowlidgable and wise. I would love it if all my classes were run this way.

This professor is probably the best professor I have had so far in school. His teaching method requires participation and is unique, but if you're able to participate and listen, you will enjoy him. supposedly econ110 is no longer being taught, but any class with him is a chance to learn something.
No Comments
No Comments

Had him for Econ110 2 sem. ago. Interesting style. Class is small 20-30 ppl. *NOTE you MUST ask questions (participate) or you will fail! Most ppl drop this class becuz of this reason. And need to read short books. The first midterm was on the books we read, and most ppl didnot read them so 1/2 of the class failed(me too) but the final fair.
very interesting prof...fun lecture!!
he is very intresting

A true academic- either love him or hate him. I think his teaching style is great. Every Arts undergrad should take his class... tests your intellectual worth, but don't take him too seriously... have fun
Awesome class and very easy
REALLY GOOD, read the material, do the assignment, ask questions!!! EASY A
nice guy, just pay attention in class, read all the books and u should be fine. discuss interesting topics in lectures as well
Pointless class and his teaching material was totally irrelevant in regards to the course...  Has very political views and is very biased in his marking
First time I ever learned something was in this class
Pay attention in class and u'll ace his course
Good prof. lectures are based on your questions. Just don't **** the guy off.
